result.execSummary:
The defendant Harry J Petrofsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine, plus all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 12/02/15, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample. The defendant was escorted forthwith to provide the sample.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, straight time. Time served disposition.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry J Petrofsky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 1 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample. The defendant was escorted forthwith to provide the sample.

Court ordered defendant to pay a $100 fine, plus all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 12/2/15, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant's driver's license SUSPENDED for 6 months to commence FORTHWITH.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Harry J Petrofsky in court with attorney Virginia Stellar for atty Glen Kulkoski.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE RECALLED AT 9:39.
Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (4/30/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. Oral No Weapons Order. Defendant has until 5pm on 4/30/15 to have all guns removed from his possession  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brian J. and Erica J. and B.J. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Harry J Petrofsky in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/29/15 @ 1:30 pm
